basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ My name is Eddie Ponce, and I am a Software Developer from Vancouver, WA. I am also a USMC Veteran who served five years on Active-Duty orders as a Ground Intelligence Analyst/Platoon Sergeant and received multiple awards and certifications during my time in service. I chose to get into Software Development because of the problem solving/critical-thinking aspect of the job and I like to think of myself as a logical thinker. I write code just about everyday and enjoy learning about new technology on my off time! Some professional skills I acquire are leadership, problem-solving, teamwork, commercial awareness, perseverance, and motivation. I'm seeking to make a positive impact in my next workspace and to continuously challenge my limits as a soon-to-be Software Developer.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Mad Library
projects.description: My group and I created a Mad Lib inspired web applet entitled 'Mad Librarians'. The purpose of the website is to provide a fun and interactive story building platform. It contains fun templatized story outlines that with the input of user imagination, generates fun and hilarious stories. My primary role for this project was to create structure and add styling to the webpageâ€™s utilizing CSS3 and HTML 5.

projects.title: CIK Studio, LLC
projects.description: I created a responsive website for my personally owned business called CIK Studio. This particular project was created through the use of a website builder named Wix. Aside from building projects with â€˜raw codeâ€™, I also enjoy freelancing on the side with website builders such as Wix, WordPress, and Elementor!
